formattedAddress: 200 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 200 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013-1807, USA

originalText.text: It was a cute experience but defintley overpriced for the value. The decor was nicely done but sparse. The decor was limited to the rooms rather than a running theme throughout. The place also felt a bit dirty(dust in places, staining on cushions etc.) The candy making experience itself was good, my daughter had fun and so did the other kids. The ingredients were simple and easy to do on their own. The items were cheap such as marshmallows, rice krispies, tootsie rolls etc. which did not warrant the price tag. Overall the experience was good but I feel it would be worth is at a $35 price point and adults should not have to pay.

I had my daughter‚Äôs birthday here today and it was absolutely amazing . Crickets Candy Boutique was amazing with their email
Communication made everything so easy . They partner with vendors and I didn‚Äôt have to do anything . They decorated the party room with my table decorations and went the extra step to make certain that everything was correct . I can‚Äôt wait to go back for a playdate . I came from New Jersey and it‚Äôs so easy to get to . Their staff members were so pleasant and it‚Äôs nice to see owners who love their venues .

originalText.text: I was totally underwhelmed by crickets candy.  I had asked for my daughter to have special accommodations made for her celiac. I found myself constantly having to remind the person in charge that I specifically asked for this prior to booking the appointment. The slime in the photos had color and they said this time of year they have holiday themes so they just put a few sprinkles of cut up candy cane. They advertise that you can make candy pizza (was a rice cake with some chocolate spread), candy jewelry (my daughter made a lame key chain that she spread frosting on and put some sprinkles). They also say that you'll make candy sushi or a burger. When I asked about it the person in charge said it was seasonal and they don't have it anymore now in the winter.  I also felt very rushed from one activity to the next. My daughter had fun but I would never recommend it to anyone.

originalText.text: Went here for a 'Girls Day' last week! It was one of the most incredible experiences of life. The decor is phenomenal, especially the new halloween additions (the bats were too cute). Great place for photos, delicious treats and fun activities. Everyone who works there is incredibly kind and generous. My favorite part was making edible paintings, so clever and innovative. My friend Betsy was so overcome by happiness she did not want to leave. Great music too!! Highly recommend visiting!
